casebody.data:
INTERNATIONAL LIFE & ANNUITY CO. v. MORTHLAND. No. 5627. Circuit Court of Appeals, Seventh Circuit. April 29, 1936. Owen Rail, of Chicago, Ill., for appellant. Louis F. Gillespie, of Springfield, Ill., for appellee.

Before EVANS and SPARKS, Circuit Judges, and BRIGGLE, District Judge.

PER CURIAM.

On consideration whereof, it is now here ordered, adjudged, and decreed by this court that the order or decree of the District Court of the United States for the Southern District of Illinois, Southern Division, in this cause appealed from be, and the same is hereby, affirmed, with costs.
